title: How to Fold a Towel Swan

steps.title: Lay a bath towel flat.
steps.content: Lay a bath towel flat. Be sure to orient it in the “landscape” position as shown below. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the top two corners downwards and inwards so that they meet in the center.
steps.content: Fold the top two corners downwards and inwards so that they meet in the center. Note that, since it's not a perfect square, they won't line up with the bottom edge of the towel. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the two outside edges inwards toward the center.
steps.content: Roll the two outside edges inwards toward the center. The resulting shape should like an upwards-pointing arrow. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the resulting arrow in to a Z.
steps.content: Fold the resulting arrow in to a Z. Be sure that the two bottom points of the arrow end up at the bottom of the Z and the top point, at the top. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Set the Z down and squeeze the corners to set the curves.
steps.content: Set the Z down and squeeze the corners to set the curves. The Z should now look like a swan. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat for a swan companion whose neck can complete a heart shape.
steps.content: Repeat for a swan companion whose neck can complete a heart shape.
